metadata.title: CVE-2021-47171 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:usb: fix memory leak in smsc75xx_bind Syzbot reported memory leak insmsc75xx_bind(). The problem was is non-freed memory in case of errorsafter memory allocation. backtrace: [<ffffffff84245b62>] kmallocinclude/linux/slab.h:556 [inline] [<ffffffff84245b62>] kzallocinclude/linux/slab.h:686 [inline] [<ffffffff84245b62>]smsc75xx_bind+0x7a/0x334 drivers/net/usb/smsc75xx.c:1460[<ffffffff82b5b2e6>] usbnet_probe+0x3b6/0xc30 drivers/net/usb/usbnet.c:1728

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1066-fips - 4.15.0-1066.75
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1066-fips - 4.15.0-1066.75
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1066-fips - 4.15.0-1066.75
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1066-fips - 4.15.0-1066.75
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2051-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2051.53
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2051-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2051.53
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2033-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2033.37
